item.title: 7 Best Mecha Games
item.description:
Summary

  • Super Robot Wars 30 features multiple mechs from different anime in a grid-based strategy RPG.
  • Zone of the Enders: The 2nd Runner offers fast-paced action gameplay with unique abilities.
  • Robot Alchemic Drive offers a unique 2nd person camera perspective and cinematic mech fights.

Whether it be a mobile high-speed mech or a more tank-like and bulky one, almost everybody has had the fantasy of piloting one of these giant machines. Various anime and films in popular culture have no doubt powered this fantasy , captivating their audiences' imaginations. While society is still a little ways off from inventing mechs, video games help fill that void.

There are a great number of video games that allow players to live out the mecha fantasy through excellent gameplay mechanics, strategy, and just plain good ol' customization. While plenty of video games have mechs in them, the truly great games of the mecha genre put a huge focus on the mechs themselves.

7 Super Robot Wars 30

A Grand Celebration Of Mecha Anime

For those who want some form of adaptation of their favorite mech anime, Super Robot Wars 30 is the way to go. Featuring multiple mechs from different anime — including but not limited to, multiple Gundam series , Code Geass, and Getter Robo — Super Robot Wars lets players assemble a team comprised of their favorite mechs. Gameplay is akin to a grid-based strategy RPG, where, as expected, the mechs are each controlled on their respective turns.

One thing that makes Super Robot Wars so fun is the unique attacks each unit has, which play out as a special animation each time they are used. They feel satisfying to execute while simultaneously giving fan service in a genuine and fun way. It is an excellent celebration of the mecha genre.

6 Zone Of The Enders: The 2nd Runner

Playable Mecha Anime

Considering how close the Metal Gear franchise is to mecha in some of its story beats, it only makes sense that Hideo Kojima would produce the second game in the Zone Of The Enders franchise. Zone Of The Enders: The 2nd Runner has players flying around in an orbital frame (this game's version of a mech) called Jehuty.

It plays like a fast-paced 3rd person action game and progression involves defeating multiple robots and other orbital frames using a variety of weapons and sub-weapons, including missiles and a laser blade. More interesting abilities, like a short-range teleport, are also available. Zone Of The Enders 2 presents its story with the occasional anime cutscene and, while the voice acting can be questionable at times, it only adds to the game's overall charm. The latest version of 2nd Runner introduces the ability to play in VR.

5 Robot Alchemic Drive

A Unique Perspective On The Genre

Platforms

PlayStation 2

Released

August 29, 2002

Developer

Sandlot

Genre

Action-Adventure

Robot Alchemic Drive , or RAD by its very appropriate shorthand, has a unique take on the mecha genre. Rather than putting the player directly in the pilot's seat of a mech, the game opts for the rather underutilized approach of a 2nd person camera. This works by having the player move a human character around in 3rd person until they can get a good view of their giant robot, before switching to robot controls, viewing the robot through the protagonist's eyes. Repositioning the camera is key to winning the game's various missions.

Besides allowing the fights to be much more cinematic than its contemporaries, this perspective also allows a unique control scheme where each analog stick controls one of the robot's arms, and the shoulder buttons control the legs. It’s a strange system to get used to at first, but one that feels incredibly satisfying to learn. Meanwhile, fights in this game take place across a city, so there's sure to be destruction when an enemy or player robot goes flying backwards after a heavy punch.

4 Into The Breach

Once More...

Going for the unique approach of a birds-eye view strategy game, Into The Breach is about time-traveling mech pilots trying and stop the invasion of an alien species called the Vek. As expected, there's a variety of different mechs and weapons to choose from and pilots come with their own special skills if they can be obtained.

Into The Breach introduces a twist on the strategy game formula, allowing players to see every move performed by their enemies and how much damage they will do, allowing players to react accordingly. It isn’t as easy as it sounds though; thinking several turns ahead is still a must for a successful run and the game can get pretty challenging at points, sometimes forcing a sacrifice of one of the units to be made in order to succeed. Thanks to its Roguelike nature and generation of levels, Into The Breach 's replayability is nigh infinite.

3 Mobile Suit Gundam Extreme VS Maxiboost On

It Has How Many Characters?

Platforms

PlayStation 4

Released

July 30, 2020

Developer

Bandai Namco Games

Genre

Fighting

Most 3D anime arena fighting games can feel incredibly shallow and succeed more on fan service than with decent gameplay. Mobile Suit Gundam Extreme VS Maxiboost On (referred to as MBON for short) is no such game. Originally a Japanese arcade exclusive before being ported to console, MBON lets players choose their favorite mobile suit from a roster of 183 options, and each one feels fleshed out and fun to play.

The game primarily focuses on 2v2 games where teams share a health bar. The stronger the mobile suit suit, the more team health is lost on death. Teams will have to communicate and work out what mobile suits synergize with each other to come out on top. MBON is also a great celebration of the Gundam franchise, with how many suits and stages it offers. Now if Bandai Namco could just get around to porting the more recent games that are currently exclusive to Japanese arcades.

2 Titanfall 2

A Movement Shooter And A Mech Game

Perhaps one of the greatest multiplayer shooters of all time, Ttanfall 2 has a nice selection of specialized mechs for any player’s preference, from the melee-focused Ronin to fire-based Scorcher. These titans will have to be earned first though, which is achieved by getting kills or scoring in multiplayer matches, which typically involves the player zipping between multiple buildings trying to outmaneuver the enemy team. The end of most matches involves chaotic bouts by both teams and their titans. It’s also possible, if challenging, to kill a titan on foot, creating an immense feeling of satisfaction when achieved.

Titanfall 2 also has an amazing single-player campaign which should not be missed. Standout missions involve the now famous time travel level (which allows players to jump between two points in time) and a mission that consists of the player fighting on an automated assembly line as it builds suburban housing.

1 Armored Core 6: Fires Of Rubicon

Turns Out Ravens Can Fly Pretty Far On Borrowed Wings

The gold standard for mech games, Armoured Core 6: Fires Of Rubicon is the culmination of everything FromSoftware has learned from its previous games. Missions are fast, frantic, and fun, often putting players up against multiple other mechs (called Cores in the universe) and gigantic bosses, and rewarding players who master the game's systems. It’s also incredibly replayable, offering multiple different endings and new missions upon starting New Game +.

Where the game really shines is in its customization options. Players have the option of the standard bipedal, tank, hover, and reverse joint Cores, all of which have their own benefits and drawbacks. Players also have access to a truly massive selection of parts and weapons, all of which can change how they play dramatically and require careful consideration to make the best builds. If that wasn’t enough, colors (as well as a player emblem) can be customized, meaning that no two Cores will ever be the same.

item.title: Wuthering Waves: Lumi Ascension Materials
item.description:
Lollo Logistics in Wuthering Waves is a common name in Huanglong, where players may have tackled many quests or event-related tasks for the organization, like the Lollo Logistics event, or the We Promise, We Deliver quest where players eventually meet the Inferno Rider boss.

There's a playable Lollo Logistics navigator in Wuthering Waves called Lumi. She's a 4-star Resonator who excels at damage dealing, although she also has a massive Skill buff from her Outro Skill. Here's what players need for Lumi ascension in WuWa , if they choose to test her abilities.

Lumi Ascension Materials In Wuthering Waves

The following materials are required for Lumi's breakthrough in Wuthering Waves :

  • Local Specialty : Terraspawn Fungus
  • Enemy Drop : LF/MF/HF/FF Howler Core
  • Boss Drop : Thundering Tacet Core
  • Weekly Boss Drop : Sentinel's Dagger
  • Forte Materials : Waveworn Residue 210/Waveworn Residue 226/Waveworn Residue 235/Waveworn Residue 239

item.title: 7 Hardest Isometric RPGs, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Isometric RPGs offer fast-paced combat, likable characters, and tons of sidequests.
  • Pathfinder: Kingmaker stands out with realm-building mechanics and replay value.
  • Baldur's Gate 3 impresses with captivating fantasy elements and challenging Honour Mode.

When it comes to RPGs that deliver an outstanding combat experience from an interesting perspective, few can match what the isometric subgenre has to offer. These titles are usually packed with fast-paced combat, likable characters, alternate good and evil routes, and tons of sidequests to discover. They also allow players to explore the world while straying from the classic top-down view.

Some isometric RPGs are good to be played once and never again, whereas others can keep players busy for months—all without ever making them feel bored or tired. Although most isometric RPGs are designed to be challenging, some go the extra mile in this regard. Here are some of the hardest Isometric RPGs out there .

7 Pathfinder: Kingmaker

A Strong Focus On Realm-building Makes This Title Great

  • Emphasis on realm-building
  • Lots of replay value

While Pathfinder: Kingmaker shares many traits with other isometric RPGs, such as the option for real-time with pause combat or turn-based mechanics, it innovates in other areas, making it a very interesting title to explore.

On top of other wonderful things this game has to offer, it emphasizes realm-building, with players' decisions as the lord of a certain settlement impacting the lives of those who live in it. This not only adds an interesting mechanic to this great title, but also gives it a layer of complexity that other games in its genre don’t have. All in all, Pathfinder: Kingmaker is fun and has a lot of replay value.

6 Shadowrun: Dragonfall

An Interesting Isometric RPG With A Classless System

  • Players arrive in the free state of Berlin to join an interesting team
  • A classless system that's unusual to see in RPGs

During the events of Shadowrun: Dragonfall , players will take on the role of a shadowrunner, who has recently arrived at a city to join a team of various mercenaries, a cyborg, a shaman and other interesting characters that add to complexity to the story.

While not the most challenging title on this list, the game still presents players with various challenges that they'll have to overcome to eventually complete it, offering hours of fun. If players want additional content, they should get the Director’s Cut, which adds new optional missions.

5 Wasteland 2

A Post-apocalyptic Title Full Of Obstacles

  • 26-year gap between Wasteland and Wasteland 2
  • Various challenges and a decent level of difficulty

When it comes to franchises that took their sweet time between releasing the first installment and the second one, Wasteland is arguably among the top 10. The first Wasteland game came out way back in 1988, and it wasn't until 2014 that Wasteland 2 was released.

Despite the 26-year gap between the first and the second installment of the franchise, Wasteland 2 managed to offer players a great experience and is considered by many to be among the greatest post-apocalyptic games of all time. This title forces players to face various challenges along the way and will keep them entertained thanks to its mechanics and level of difficulty.

4 Pillars Of Eternity 2: Deadfire

Great Class System For Players To Choose From

  • A direct sequel to Pillars of Eternity
  • Challenging combat and wonderful locations

As a direct sequel to the original Pillars of Eternity and taking place in the world of Eora, this title puts players in the shoes of a Watcher, who can look into people’s souls and memories and access their past lives to learn more about them.

Pillars of Eternity 2: Deadfire features challenging combat, an interesting story, and a well-crafted class system that gives players a lot of options when it comes to choosing how they want to play the game and how they want to deal with their enemies.

3 Disco Elysium

Interesting Combat Mechanics And Interactions

  • Harry Du Bois must solve a murder
  • Amazing world design and color palette

Disco Elysium is an amazing RPG that puts players in the shoes of Lieutenant Harrier Dubois, also known as “Harry” Du Bois. Harry is a depressed alcoholic who finds himself amid an amnesic episode as he tries to solve a murder that no one else has been able to.

Not only is the color palette and overall world design of Disco Elysium very interesting, but the various encounters and captivating dialogues that players can be a part of, add a layer of complexity, mystery, and excitement to the title.

2 Divinity: Original Sin 2

A Crowdfunded Title That Delivers On Its Promises

  • Great class system
  • Beautiful world design

Although many players argue that the story of Divinity: Original Sin 2 is rather linear and that the true treasure can be found in the characters and different classes the game offers, the world design and overall mechanics of this title are also part of what makes it shine.

With a well-developed turn-based tactical combat system, an isometric perspective, and a decent number of challenges for players to face and overcome throughout the story, Divinity: Original Sin 2 is, without a doubt, one of the greatest isometric RPGs out there.

1 Baldur's Gate 3

Arguably The Best Fantasy RPG Of The 2020s

  • Amazing fantasy elements that are captivating and immersive
  • Honour Mode makes the game much harder

Baldur’s Gate 3 is one of the best fantasy RPGs released in the last 10 years thanks to its likable characters, amazing class and combat systems, and beautiful world design that captivates and immerses players within minutes of starting the game.

Among the many interesting things about this title, there's the possibility for players to respec their companions in many different ways to adapt to the challenges that are put in front of them. While not recommended for newcomers to the franchise, players looking for a challenge can try Honour Mode, which not only makes enemies much harder to defeat, but will also end players’ run after a single death of all party members.

item.title: 10 Best Heroes In Kingdom Rush 5: Alliance TD, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Master heroes like Nyru, Raelyn, and Anya for synergy with towers and maps for triumph in Kingdom Rush 5.
  • Early heroes like Raelyn are effective for initial challenges, while late-game heroes like Kosmyr offer powerful utility.
  • Kosmyr dominates with devastating hailstorms, Lumenir blocks pathways, and Warhead withstands tough battles effectively.

In Kingdom Rush 5: Alliance TD , heroes are pivotal to success, serving as both the vanguard and the last line of defense. Unlike many tower defense games of the genre, Kingdom Rush's inclusion of heroes adds an extra level of strategy. They are completely separate and fully controllable characters with which to support lanes and towers.

Mastering a chosen hero and ensuring they complement the map and tower setup is essential for triumph. Without this synergy, even the most skilled players will struggle to overcome certain stages. Although heroes unlock progressively throughout the main campaign, some exceptional ones are accessible early, helping players breeze through initial challenges. However, the most powerful heroes only become available after completing the game. These late-stage champions are perfect for mopping up stars and tackling tougher challenges.

10 Nyru

A Tricky Forest Protector

  • Health: 215
  • Attack: 14-30 (Melee), 18-53 (Ranged)
  • Armor: None
  • Speed: 95

Nyru is a must-have hero when flying enemies enter the fray. This nimble forest protector excels at quick map traversal, allowing players to handle threats before they overwhelm their defenses. Additionally, Nyru can attack both air and ground enemies effectively.

While his hero ability only spawns thorns on the ground and can’t target flying enemies, Nyru’s speed and versatility make him a valuable asset in many situations. Just be cautious — his defense is on the weaker side, so it’s best to keep him out of prolonged skirmishes.

9 Raelyn

Leader Of The Dark Knights

  • Health: 400
  • Attack: 24-36
  • Armor: 50%
  • Speed: 50

Raelyn is one of the first heroes players will acquire, and she can easily carry them through the early stages and well into the second area. Specializing in handling ground-based enemies, she pairs perfectly with ranged towers to trap and eliminate swift foes.

Her main drawback is her slow movement speed, which makes repositioning her across the map a tedious process. It’s often better to station Raelyn in high-traffic areas where she can maximize her impact.

8 Anya

A Dhampir Fighting The Forces of Evil

  • Health: 400
  • Attack: 8-12 (Melee), 48-70 (Ranged)
  • Armor: 25%
  • Speed: 95

Anya is a dynamic gunslinging dhampir who can seamlessly switch between long-ranged attacks for airborne enemies and melee combat for ground foes. She’s remarkably mobile, transforming into smoke to traverse the map quickly , and her hero ability activates instantly, making her a reliable choice.

While her defense isn’t the strongest, a fully upgraded Anya can carry players far into the campaign, proving invaluable in high-pressure stages.

7 Onagro

A Goblin War Machine

  • Health: 290
  • Attack: 27-41
  • Armor: 64%
  • Speed: 42

For any players who enjoy explosive gameplay, Onagro is the hero for them. With high durability and devastating attacks, this goblin war machine can wreak havoc on enemy hordes. However, his slow movement and the delayed activation of his hero ability require precise timing and strategic positioning.

Despite these challenges, Onagro’s sheer power and ability to absorb damage make him a solid choice for players who can master his quirks.

6 Grimson

An Abomination Seeking Revenge

  • Health: 400
  • Attack: 20-28
  • Armor: None
  • Speed: 95

Grimson is a durable hero that players will likely rely on frequently, especially as they upgrade his abilities. His resilience makes him perfect for throwing into chaotic battles , where he can slow down enemies and absorb considerable damage.

Though his attack speed is slower than others, Grimson’s ability to move across the map efficiently allows for timely interventions. His hero ability requires careful planning, but when used effectively, it can turn the tide of battle.

5 Broden

A Griffon Rider With A Gun

  • Health: 460
  • Attack: 26-38
  • Armor: None
  • Speed: 120

Broden provides unparalleled air support, prioritizing flying enemies that other heroes might overlook. His hero ability locks onto airborne foes, making him a lifesaver on maps with overwhelming aerial threats.

Thanks to his griffon mount , Broden can bypass obstacles and reach key areas quickly. However, his attack speed could be faster, which might leave players wishing for a little more efficiency in high-pressure moments.

4 Therien

A Powerful Voidmancer

  • Health: 250
  • Attack: 15-24 (Melee), 26-48 (Ranged)
  • Armor: None
  • Speed: Teleport

Therien becomes available midway through the campaign and is one of the most versatile heroes in the game. Her teleportation ability allows her to reposition easily, while her long-range attacks target both flying and ground enemies.

Her low defense is offset by her ability to escape crowded areas, and her passive skill extends tower ranges temporarily — a game-changer in the later stages. Therien’s crowd-control hero ability is a must-have for managing the chaos of the final levels.

3 Warhead

A Dark Army Automaton

  • Health: 335
  • Attack: 15-23
  • Armor: 69%
  • Speed: 152

Warhead is a mechanical tank built to withstand even the toughest battles. Though he’s slow-moving, his durability and powerful abilities make him a reliable choice during the game’s most challenging stages.

His hero ability deals significant damage to large groups of enemies, and his ability to hold his own means players won’t need to micromanage him much. Warhead’s utility in the final campaign stages is second to none.

2 Kosmyr

Just Wants Peace And Quiet

  • Health: 580
  • Attack: 35-55
  • Armor: None
  • Speed: 100

Kosmyr , a powerful dragon, becomes available after beating the main campaign. This hero excels at dominating enemy groups with devastating crystal hailstorms and dive-bombing attacks. With Kosmyr on a player's team, few enemies will stand a chance.

Even without full upgrades, Kosmyr is a powerhouse that can carry most players through harder difficulties and help them achieve three stars across all stages.

1 Lumenir

Avatar Of Justice And Resolve

  • Health: 500
  • Attack: 38-74
  • Armor: 36%
  • Speed: 120

Lumenir , another premium dragon hero , is unlocked post-campaign and is a force to be reckoned with. Their instant-activation hero ability blocks pathways with fighters, buying valuable time for Lumenir to deal massive damage.

In the early stages, Lumenir’s sheer strength can singlehandedly clear paths, reducing the need for extensive tower support. Their versatility and overwhelming power make them one of the most impactful heroes in the game.

item.title: Path of Exile 2: All Map Icons Explained
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Map Icons In Path of Exile 2
  • How Do Map Icons Work In Path of Exile 2

Path of Exile 2 has multiple Acts for you to complete, each with its own map filled with icons to discover. Your map will be central for fast traveling across multiple areas at once, though the icons found on the map can help greatly when searching for optional content.

Each area you visit will usually be tied with a main quest, but there will still be lots of optional content that is worth completing. Here's what every map icon means and how to visit the various icons found on the map.

All Map Icons In Path of Exile 2

Map Icon

Name

Explanation

Current Location

Appears over the area the player is currently in.

Town

The location of a hub town in the Act.

Unknown Area

An area you have not visited at all.

Visited Area

An area visited without a waypoint.

Area With Inactive Waypoint

An area visited but the waypoint has not been discovered.

Area With Active Waypoint

An area with an active waypoint that will be the destination of your fast travel.

Quest Location

The location of a main or side quest.

Travel Destination

A location you can travel to from the map.

Rare Monster Encounter

A powerful yellow-named enemy is found in that area.

Rare Monster Encounter With Djinn Barya

A powerful yellow-named enemy is found in that area that will drop ascendancy items.

Boss Encounter

A boss is found somewhere in that area.

Boss Encounter With Upgrade

A boss is found somewhere in that area and will drop a Quest Item used for an upgrade.

Boss Encounter With Djinn Barya

A boss is found somewhere in that area and will drop an ascendency item.

Act Boss Encounter

The final boss of that act is found in that area.

Notable Chest

A rare chest containing powerful loot is found in that area.

Notable Item

A rare item is found somewhere in that area.

How Do Map Icons Work In Path of Exile 2

If you wish to find an icon, such as a boss encounter, you'll need to travel to the area to which that icon is attached to. Traveling there will create an Instance and randomly generate the location of that icon's cause somewhere in that Instance . There will just about always be some level of exploration to find the cause of an icon due to the random nature of the game's maps.

There will also be icons unique to some side quests, indicating where you need to go in order to complete that quest. A small yellow cave icon over a waypoint also indicates a dungeon instead of a more open area.
